description: Job Description Join the forefront of innovation in the networking industry! As we expand our influence in the Public sector, encompassing the Federal sector, SLED (State and Local government and education), and Healthcare, we are seeking a dynamic Marketing Director to lead the charge. If you're a strategic thinker, a seasoned leader with a penchant for collaboration, and have a track record of driving successful marketing initiatives, we want you on our team. Key Responsibilities: As the Marketing Director for the Public Sector, your responsibilities will include: Strategic Marketing Planning: Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies tailored to the unique challenges and opportunities within the Federal sector, SLED, and healthcare. Align marketing efforts with overall business objectives. Lead Generation: Leverage your extensive experience to design and implement effective lead generation content strategies. Work closely with Field Marketing teams to ensure seamless execution and optimal results. Campaign Excellence: in collaboration with the campaign team, run high-impact marketing campaigns that resonate with target audiences. Monitor and analyze campaign performance, adjusting strategies as needed to achieve and exceed goals. Collaboration with Sales: Forge strong partnerships with Sales teams, ensuring marketing initiatives align with sales objectives. Utilize your communication skills to foster collaboration and drive collective success. Team Management: Lead and inspire a high-performing marketing team, providing mentorship and guidance. Cultivate a culture of innovation and collaboration to maximize individual and team potential. Global Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work seamlessly with cross-functional global teams to ensure consistency in messaging and strategies. Collaborate with international counterparts to leverage best practices and global insights. Executive Engagement: Engage effectively with senior executives. Translate marketing strategies into actionable plans that resonate with leadership and contribute to overall business success. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field; MBA preferred. 8-10 years of proven experience in marketing roles within the networking industry, with a focus on the Public sector, SLED, and healthcare. Demonstrated success in lead generation, campaign management, and collaboration with Sales teams. Experience managing teams and fostering a culture of excellence. Experience working with cross-functional teams across geographies and managing external stakeholders. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with experience engaging with senior executives. Comfortable working under pressure, adapting to changing priorities and voicing solutions to challenges. Minimum Salary: $172,500.00 Maximum Salary:$264,500.00 The pay range for this position is expected to be between $172,500.00 and $264,500.00/year; however, the base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position also includes medical benefits, 401(k) eligibility, vacation, sick time, and parental leave. Additional details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an "at-will position" and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors. Juniper's pay range data is provided in accordance with local state pay transparency regulations. Juniper may post different minimum wage ranges for permanent residency petitions pursuant to US Department of Labor requirements. J-18808-Ljbffr
